page.title: 05Communications,Stallingboro'
page.content: Letters. Deliveries are mornings, collections mornings and evenings (excluding Sundays). Delivery is made by a lady on a bicycle and to outlying houses by van. A first class letter costs 17p, second class 13p. Letters have largely been replaced by the telephone as a "means of keeping in touch". Therefore most mail is of a busines nature. Telephone: Most homes now have these. A public call box is sited in the centre of the village. Stallingborough comes under the Grimsby Exchange. There are private and business lines. Rental is paid quarterly in advance, for business lines the cost is Â£23.50, for private Â£15.15 The rate for a call is 4.70p/unit and is paid quarterly in arrears. British Telecom have a monopoly on calls but some phones themselves are now available elsewhere
